meanings.definition: To associate or keep company with someone
meanings.sent1: She enjoys consorting with her friends at the park.
meanings.sent2: The cat was consorting with the dog in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The idea of the cat consorting with the mouse is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The sun consorting with the moon creates a beautiful sky.
meanings.sent5: The image of the birds consorting in the trees is peaceful.

meanings.definition: To be in harmony or agreement with something
meanings.sent1: His actions are consorting well with his words.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the painting are consorting perfectly with each other.
meanings.sent3: The idea of the cat consorting with the mouse is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The melody consorting with the lyrics creates a beautiful song.
meanings.sent5: The flavors in the dish consorting together create a delicious meal.
